name: The Galvestonian

reviews.text: We went to the Galvestonian this past June. It is a very nice property with a good pool and a great, clean beach that does not require crossing Seawall. Our one bedroom condo (306) had two large balconies over looking the gulf. It was nicely furnished and very clean. The appliances were old school but served the purpose. The only negative we experienced was from the staff. They were consistently non attentive and seemed to be bothered when you spoke to them. Luckily,we didn't have to much occasion to deal with them. For the price and location this is better then any of the Seawall hotels we have stayed in (San Luis, Hilton, & Holiday Inn). Give the staff an attidude adjustment and this place would be 1st rate.
reviews.title: Nice Condos Poor Staff
Reservations system is a mess
reviews.text: We have been coming to the Galvestonian for the last 7 years and never have had a problem with reservations or their reservation system until this summer. We have been told several times rooms were available for July 2005 only to be called back and informed that their was nothing available. The online reservation system used to always work without any hitches, but the management team seems to not have a clue as to how to bring it back onone and working properly. It is such a shame that so many are probably experiencing the same probelm as us, because the facility is always first class....I guess we will be going to Disney World after all this summer

reviews.title: Lost reservations!
reviews.text: We stayed here in 1999 and it was great! So this year I booked a room on JANUARY 12TH!!! For the week of July 4th...I got a call YESTERDAY that 138 room reservations were LOST!!! Just gone.. So they overbooked..Told us there is nothing till AUGUST!! This was our 1 shot at our annual summer vacation! Thanks!! It is too late to book anywhere else...So a 2yr old, 5yr old and 13yr old are missing out this year..From what I read this is not the 1st time..Of course the guy that called said he is "new"..SO of course it is not his fault! I even have a confirmation number (and room number we were in!) and had given my American Express info?? Lost?? Who has it??
So this room that they booked to someone else is now theirs and not ours that was Supposedly being held since Jan 12th!!
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.text: Nice way to run a business!! I hope the other 138 rooms lost show up on his doorstep Monday the 4th and he has to tell them in person..Sorry you have to go back home!! He did try to get me a 1 bedroom (for 5 people..NO) on Mon and Tues!! We are driving 9 HOURS!! Sorry but we are not turning around and coming back home 9 HOURS for 2 days!!
reviews.title: Surely the best place to stay in Galveston
Right Smack Dab on the Beach
reviews.text: It was my pleasure to find a beautiful property with great landscaping, great pool heated of course, and location is right on the beach. From the first moment a member of the staff opened the wind blown front door we felt at home. Terry, the general manager was incredible. He was proactive in everything we needed. The maintenance, housekeeping, and front desk were well trained and very attentive. Our unit was 1003 and had just been redone from ceiling to floor and furnished with all new furniture. My favorite was the wall mounted Plasma screen TV. I will definately be back.

reviews.title: "I'll Be Back"
reviews.text: ... an off the beaten path little bit of paradise where the beach is but a few steps from the door. The people are warm, friendly, and professional. I have been several times and hate leaving. Need less to say, "I Will Be Back".

My wife,family and I have stayed at the Galvestonian many, many times over the past three years and love it more each time. It is clearly located on the best beach in Galveston and is isolated enough for long, wonderful private beach walks on crisp and windy days. You can watch the cruise ships exit and returnto the gulf very close by and everything historic in the city is about a five minute drive away. The property is very well manitained and each unit is uniquely designed by the owners. Be careful to choose those that are well designed, by interior designers.Some units are a little dated looking but others are simply marvelous.Don't expect a hotel experience with bell hops and and the normal hotel stuff. This is a privately owned facility that happens to rent units. The staff is very friendly, if you make an effort to get to know them and very helpful when you need them.Our rooms have always been clean and neat.The renovation of the main lobby will be complete in by mid-November and should really add a special appeal. All in all it's a great place for a Galveston getaway especially in the off-season.
reviews.title: The perfect Galveston retreat
Nightmare on the balcony
reviews.text: No consistancy. No rules on condo owners that charge $150 a night then have dirty moldy smelling 70s vintage carpet,adirty teal wornout bathmat and an air conditioner that wouldnt go under 80 degrees. Skip room 1108. We spent the first night on balcony,it was so hot.They moved us next day. View,beach and pool are good. Nothing like it in Galveston but we didnt get a refund on first night camping on balcony.Its not worth the risk to get a crummy room and pay more than you would at the Hotel Galvez.

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!
reviews.text: The Galvestonian was wonderful, very clean and quiet - the best beach in the city. The staff was very helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Galveston since Ike. I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. In the past, we had our own place on the west end for a while or would rent down that way. We decided to stay on the east end of the island because we'd heard that it had some good areas for collecting glass and peppermint shrimp (our primary purpose.) I called the Galvestonian to reserve a small one bedroom for the weekend of 7/17-19. They were nice enough to warn me in advance that some construction was going on. I imagine a some people would be upset about the construction, but we barely noticed it at all. There was no noticable noise...just an extremely courteous worker sharing an elevator every so often. I called the day that we were leaving to confirm our reservations (as I always do) and they couldn't find them. When I looked at the confirmation email, it turned out that I'd been confirmed for the weekend PRIOR to the one we were planning on coming down. I never noticed the simple mistake. I explained over the phone that I had never intended to come that weekend...hadn't noticed the incorrect date on the email...and so on. They fixed everything right away. Granted, they did make a mistake, but they also did NOT charge me for a stay I had not used but mistakenly confirmed and they provided a room for the correct dates at the agreed upon price. I was very happy with the remedy. The lobby and grounds of the hotel are lovely. The beach is great...one of the widest on the island....although the water is the same everywhere (they can't fix that!). Our unit was nice and comfortable and well stocked. We'll definitely return to the Galvestonian. Thanks!
reviews.title: They solved a problem I didn't know about!
Great time at the Galvestonian
reviews.text: We've previously stayed at the San Luis, the Hilton, the Galvez, the Holiday Inn, the Casa del Mar, and the Victorian. This was our first visit to the Galvestonian and we WILL be returning. Our family stayed two nights in unit 809, which is a small one bedroom. The unit was clean and comfortable, and we felt very safe during our stay. The staff was courteous and the lobby was very pretty. Our favorite thing about the Galvestonian was the fact that it is directly on the beach, saving us from dodging traffic while crossing Seawall Blvd as we've done many times before. Our unit had a rocker glider, which was nice when our baby wanted to be rocked. We also enjoyed having the kitchen available for simple breakfasts, etc. The ONLY problem we encountered was that our sleeper sofa was broken. The pool/deck area is beautiful, and the view from the balcony at any unit is unbeatable. We will definitely be staying at the Galvestonian again in the future, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing place to stay while in Galveston. Yes, it is a mile off the beaten path, but WELL worth it for the relaxing atmosphere and convenience to the beach. (FYI - no lifeguard at the pool or the beach, so watch your children!) Suggestions for improvement: a larger fitness center (it was a small room and had only a few items to offer) and an on-site cafe for simple meals.

We just completed a 5 day stay at the Galvestonian. Our first time to stay there, after a couple of friends recommended it. The place did not seem all that full, but our request for an updated unit was met with "not available". The unit was clean enough, but the rusty frying plans were not what we had in mind, nor was the broken piece of glass in the kitchen cabinet.
reviews.title: Not a good value for the price, and staff didn't seem to care how our stay was.

reviews.text: Beds were not very comfortable, and the unit was listed as having "two balconies" - well, one of them, off the master bedroom, is about 2 feet deep - not sure what you're supposed to do with that. When we checked in, I had to actually sign a document that I received a multi-page list of things we were not supposed to do, that they were not responsible for, what they did not provide. What we DIDN'T get was one single page that listed the amenities available to guests. On day 3 I stumbled on free coffee in the lobby and a guest-use computer. No TV channel guide, and one decent TV. Master had a 13 " with no DVD.
reviews.title: Perfect, affordable beach getaway!
romantic getaway
reviews.text: They do not provide any beach services. Chairs / umbrellas are provided by a private vendor for $25 / day. No boogie boards, nothing at all but beach towels. Nothing at the pool either - no floats, noodles, etc. Or they may have all sorts of things at the pool for us to have used, but since they don't tell you what they provide....
My family and I found this jewel just by driving by in the spring.

reviews.title: relaxing stay at the Galvestonian

reviews.text: We loved the Galvestonian! The condos are directly on the beach, unlike most places in Galveston. Very family friendly, nice rooms, clean beach, close to everything in Galveston! My family will return to the Galvestonian on our next trip to Galveston.
reviews.title: Terrific spot !
Sweet Retreat
reviews.text: We picked the Galvestonian based on the positive reviews here on TripAdvisor and were very happy with the choice. The two bedroom unit we rented, #914, had been recently updated with new furniture and granite. The only thing that was not new and needed changing, or stretching at minimum, was the carpet. Our view of the East Beach, Gulf of Mexico and the pool directly below were wonderful. The property has a small fitness facility, two computers in the lobby for guest use and a laundry room as well (we did not use these), but did bring our own laptop and used it in the condo with their WIFI at no charge. While Galveston was packed everywhere we went over the weekend this stretch of beach remained quiet and the pool was never too crowded. We will definitely stay here again!

description: The Galvestonian is designed for pleasure and relaxation. For outdoor fun, the large heated swimming pool, which features a hot-tub Jacuzzi, is elevated on a deck which runs almost the entire length of the building. This affords the privacy you deserve, plus a spectacular view of the Gulf of Mexico. The spacious poolside cabana is quiet, shaded area for enjoying pool side refreshments. For tennis buffs, there are two lighted courts. And, of course, there are miles of beach a few steps down from the pool deck. You can stroll along the water's edge, build sand castles or simply relax on the sand and let the sun's golden rays warm your body.East Beach is the most exclusive beach in Texas. Only 50 minutes from Hobby Airport and only three minutes from downtown Galveston. East Beach is a hideaway which will allow you to escape life's pressures.
